DOC.HEAD: Bolivian Plane Crash Kills 22
DOC.TEXT: A passenger plane crashed and burned in Bolivia's tropical lowlands on Thursday and 22 of the people aboard were killed, including two American women, the air force reported. It said five people survived, but all were in serious condition. The air force Hercules plane provided passenger service to several cities. It was bound for Santa Cruz, but crashed soon after takeoff from Guayaramerin Airport, 550 miles northeast of La Paz near the Brazilian border. The air force gave the names of the two American women to the U.S. Embassy in La Paz. No details will be released until positive identification is made and next of kin are notified, embassy press attache Bruce Wharton said.
